title: Inglorious Basterds Trailer typeface
content:
Hello All,  
Does anyone recognize the heavily-slabbed stencil typeface used in the trailer for Tarantino's new movie, Inglorious Basterds?  
Sample shot below. Thank you in advance.  
-Nickolas

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/inglorious_6616.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [inglorious.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061600/http:/typophile.com/files/inglorious.jpg) | 47.53 KB |
author: nickolaspeter

comments.content:
I continued my search, and found that it's a free font, who would've thought.  
In case anyone was wondering, it's called GASMASK and available at dafont:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/font.php?file=gasmask&page=1&nb\_ppp\_old=50&text=SE...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061600/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=gasmask&page=1&nb_ppp_old=50&text=SEEN+WAR&nb_ppp=50&psize=m&classt=alpha "http://www.dafont.com/font.php?file=gasmask&page=1&nb\_ppp\_old=50&text=SEEN+WAR&nb\_ppp=50&psize=m&classt=alpha")

any idea of the font used in the movie, such as during the opening credits?

for those of you who have seen the movie, as an image of the opening credits is not easily found...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/inglourious-basterds-teaser-poster_3665.jpg)

@ ianapoc: The 'Inglourious Basterds' font ID was answered a few weeks ago.

[http://typophile.com/node/58345](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061600/http:/typophile.com/node/58345 "http://typophile.com/node/58345")
ahh thanks much, i tryed searching inglorious basterds and it didn't show up.

You probably didn't misspell the title correctly.

- Lex

Does anyone know the subhead font? It's definitely not Gasmask, Egypitenne or Beton.  
WhatTheFont's guesses were \*way\* off.

Sample attached

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/typesample_6458.jpg)

Did I ID this before? [Yes, I did](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061600/http:/typophile.com/node/61512).

Please start a new thread next time.
Thanks for the good info! The snarkiness, not so much.
